summerKungFuCamp: Summer Kung Fu Camp • January 6-9 • João Pessoa
aboutSectionDescription: The Summer Kung Fu Camp was created to unify body, mind, and spirit. Inspired by the ancient practices of Shaolin monks, this event is an invitation for you to discover your inner strength, cultivate discipline, and find harmony through three fundamental pillars.
aboutSectionQuote: "Awakening the Inner Dragon" is more than a metaphor. The dragon symbolizes the evolutionary nature of our DNA—a structure of curves, golden ratios, and rotations. Our Kung Fu practices use spiral movements to generate and channel energy, elevating states of consciousness. This approach connects to the new paradigm of sports science, which trains high-performance athletes with a focus on the fascia—the connective tissue network that integrates the entire body. By training the fascia with rotational movements, we awaken this ancestral energy for unprecedented physical and mental performance.
bodyPillarDescription: Strengthen your physique with the discipline and energy of Shaolin Kung Fu, developing agility, strength, and resilience.
mindPillarDescription: Expand your consciousness with the teachings of the I-Ching, applying ancient wisdom for clarity and strategy.
spiritPillarDescription: Harmonize your vital energy through Chinese Medicine, achieving inner balance and lasting well-being.
activitiesSectionDescription: Explore the three ancient arts that form the foundation of our journey. Each activity is a gateway to a new level of self-knowledge and mastery.
shaolinKungFuDescription: Learn the fighting and meditation techniques that made the Shaolin monks legendary. For all levels.
chineseMedicineDescription: Discover the secrets of acupuncture, moxibustion, and sound therapies for healing and energy balance.
wisdomOfIChingDescription: Explore the 'Book of Changes' as a tool for self-knowledge and decision-making.
phasesSectionDescription: Our 6-day retreat offers a space with specific dynamics for three phases of life, ensuring a transformative and suitable experience for everyone.
littleDragonDescription: In a playful and safe way, children embark on an adventure through martial arts. The classes explore the creativity and energy of the little ones through the forms of Wu Xing Ba Fa (the 5 sacred animals) and the agile Mantis Qixing Tanglang (7 stars). More than learning movements, they develop coordination, discipline, and the values of respect of Kung Fu in an environment full of games and fun.
warriorJourneyDescription: A complete immersion to enhance your skills and deepen your martial knowledge. The program integrates the solid foundation of Shaolin (Wu Bu Quan) and the fluidity of Meihua Quan (Wu Shi), with the structure of Wing Chun (Siu Nim Tao) and the speed of the Praying Mantis (Saam Bo Jin). All learning is applied in safe and controlled Sanda (Chinese Boxing) combat dynamics, uniting technique, strategy, and meditation in motion.
pathOfHarmonyDescription: With a focus on vitality, health, and well-being, this journey is an invitation to cultivate your inner energy. Through the gentle practices of Qi Gong, the moving meditation of Tai Chi (8-step form), and the circular fluidity of Bagua Zhang (8 Mother Palms), participants strengthen the body, improve balance, and calm the mind, promoting a longer and healthier life.
mentorSectionDescription: Shi Heng Yong Yi, is a 36th generation Shaolin monk, combining modern technology and ancient wisdom to guide you on this journey.
biographyContent1: 35th generation Shaolin Monk (Shi Heng Yong Yi) with training at the Shaolin Temple in China and ordination as a Theravada Monk in Thailand (Santitammo). He has experience in martial arts, I-Ching, Chinese medicine, Tibetan bowl therapy, human design, meditation, and more.
biographyContent2: He holds a degree in technology in the fields of computing and robotics. He develops multidisciplinary projects in the areas of digital games, biohacking, and robots.
biographyContent3: For the last six years, he has traveled the world to learn about new cultures and integrate ancestral wisdom with modern technologies. During this time, he had contact with different schools of Buddhism including: Zen (Japan), Nichiren Shoshu (Japan), Theravada (Thailand), and Shaolin (China), as well as different styles of martial arts.
philosophyContent1: Learn Kung Fu with routines of the Shaolin Monks that aim for fullness between body, mind, and spirit. The focus is to improve the quality of life by developing discipline through motivation. Classes can be focused on one of eight styles: Shaolin, Meihua-Chuan, Bagua-Zhang, Wing-Chun, Praying Mantis, Tai-Chi, Qi-Gong, or Sanda.
philosophyContent2: Each class follows a twelve-step progression with routines to improve: breathing, energy, resilience, speed, strength, flexibility, flow, expression, control, reflex, and attitude. The purpose is to understand martial arts from the interpretation of the Book of Changes (I-Ching) and integration with Chinese medicine.

mustBeLoggedInToBook: You must be logged in to book a class.

energyMarketplaceDescription: Purchase energy credits to participate in classes and workshops. Each credit allows you to book a 2-hour class.
flexibilityForOneDay: Flexibility for one day of practices
goodForDeepening: Good for deepening in one style
accessToAllClasses: Access to all classes and workshops
hostingDescription: Accommodation costs R$64 per night. Experience full immersion by staying at Yolo Hostel. You can also cover your stay by volunteering at the event.
directBookingInfo: Booking is made directly with the organization.
securePaymentNotice: Purchases are securely processed by Stripe.
loginToBuy: You need to be logged in to buy.
freeClassDescription: Enter your email to join our community and we'll redirect you to complete your registration and claim your benefits.
freeClassSubDescription: By joining, you receive exclusive content, training tips, and all the news about the camp.
locationDescription: Your journey will take place between the vibrant energy of the hostel and the serenity of the beach.
yoloHostelDescription: Our base will be Yolo Hostel, a welcoming and vibrant space. Workshops, meals, and integration moments will happen here. The shared rooms are perfect for the warrior's rest and for strengthening community bonds.
tambuBeachDescription: Outdoor practices, such as Kung Fu and Tai Chi at sunrise, will be held on the golden sand of Tambaú Beach. Feel the ocean's energy while harmonizing body and mind in a stunning setting.
mapSectionDescription: Find your way around the event and stay up-to-date with all the news in real time.
faqDescription: Get your questions answered and prepare for the journey.
faq1Question: Do I need to have previous martial arts experience?
faq1Answer: No, it's not necessary. We have specific classes and activities for beginners. The Warrior's Journey is aimed at those who already practice, but the event as a whole welcomes all levels.
faq2Question: What is included in the ticket price?
faq2Answer: Each ticket category has its benefits. Generally, they include access to classes and workshops in your category, some meals, and access to common areas. Accommodation is not included. Check the Tickets section for details.
faq3Question: Will there be food options on site?
faq3Answer: Yes, the hostel's kitchen will be available if you prefer to prepare your own meals. We will also offer full meals on site for R$22.50 each, with varied options for all tastes.
faq4Question: What is the minimum age for the children's phase?
faq4Answer: The 'Awakening of the Little Dragon' program is recommended for children aged 7 to 12. The activities are adapted for this age group.
faq5Question: What should I bring to the event?
faq5Answer: We recommend comfortable clothes for physical activities, sunscreen, a reusable water bottle, and most importantly, an open mind and a heart willing to learn.
volunteerDescription: Be a volunteer and experience the Summer Kung Fu Camp up close! Help with the organization and support of the event and participate in training as part of the team. Fill in the fields below and click the button to send us an email.
volunteerMessagePlaceholder: Tell us why you want to be a volunteer and if you have any special skills (organization, communication, etc).

hostingBookingDescription: Stay at the heart of the event. Booking is made directly with the organization to ensure the best experience. Fill in the fields below to start contact.
